DataElement.preferredName: Upper Gastrointestinal Endoscopy Gastrointestinal Primary Malignant Neoplasm Negative Finding Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indication of whether an upper gastrointestinal endoscopy was performed that excluded a gastrointestinal primary malignancy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Upper Gastrointestinal Endoscopy Gastrointestinal Primary Malignant Neoplasm Negative Finding Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two._Any endoscopic procedure that visualizes a part of the gastrointestinal tract._Pertaining to the stomach and intestines._A malignant tumor at the original site of growth._A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.:Any endoscopic procedure that visualizes a part of the gastrointestinal tract.

Concepts.definition: Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.
Any endoscopic procedure that visualizes a part of the gastrointestinal tract.

Property.preferredName: Gastrointestinal Primary Malignant Neoplasm Negative Finding Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.:A malignant tumor at the original site of growth.:A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.
A malignant tumor at the original site of growth.
A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was upper GI-endoscopy perfor
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was upper GI-endoscopy performed with negative results to exclude a gastrointestinal primary malignancy?
